column4: !info libimobiledevice2 | thedingo   may i ask why you don't use the version from the repo?

it is in main, no launchpad repo needed
either way. it doesn't work for me
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install libimobiledevice2
i've tried that as well
!work | thedingo
Am I missing a repo or something?
lsb_release -sc  says what?
it just says package not found
command not found...
so you're not using ubuntu?
i have all ubuntu repos...
so you're not using ubuntu?
i'm going to school for network admin and infosec so I have backtrack which I was told is essentially ubuntu with programs pre-installed
